title: User Story & Acceptance Tests
original_prompt: Write an user story explaining how an user will be able to login into the app then in a second paragraph, write its user acceptance tests
input1:
As a user, I want to be able to log into the app using my email and password so that I can access my personalized dashboard and manage my tasks efficiently. After entering my credentials, I expect to see a welcome message and be redirected to the main interface where I can view my ongoing projects and notifications.

In order to ensure the login functionality works as intended, the following user acceptance tests will be conducted: 1) Verify that users can successfully log in with valid credentials and are redirected to the dashboard. 2) Check that an error message is displayed when incorrect credentials are entered. 3) Ensure that the "Forgot Password" link functions correctly, allowing users to reset their password via email. 4) Confirm that the login session persists until the user manually logs out.
input2:
As a user, I want to log into the app using my social media account so that I can quickly access my profile without remembering another password. After clicking the "Login with Facebook" button, I expect to be prompted to authorize the app and then redirected to my account page, where I can see my recent activities and updates.

To validate the login process, the following user acceptance tests will be performed: 1) Test that users can log in successfully using their Facebook account and are taken to their account page. 2) Verify that users who deny authorization receive an appropriate message and are not logged in. 3) Check that users can log out and that their session is terminated correctly. 4) Ensure that the app handles cases where the Facebook account is not linked to an existing app account, prompting the user to create one.
input1_ans:
**User Story:**

As a user, I want to be able to log into the app using my email and password so that I can access my personalized dashboard and manage my tasks efficiently. After entering my credentials, I expect to see a welcome message and be redirected to the main interface where I can view my ongoing projects and notifications. This seamless login process will enhance my experience and allow me to focus on my tasks without unnecessary delays.

**User Acceptance Tests:**

1) Verify that users can successfully log in with valid credentials and are redirected to the dashboard, displaying a welcome message.  
2) Check that an error message is displayed when incorrect credentials are entered, ensuring users are informed of the issue.  
3) Ensure that the "Forgot Password" link functions correctly, allowing users to initiate a password reset process via email and receive a confirmation message.  
4) Confirm that the login session persists until the user manually logs out, and that the user remains logged in when navigating back to the app.  
5) Test the login functionality on various devices and browsers to ensure compatibility and responsiveness.
input2_ans:
**User Story:**

As a user, I want to log into the app using my social media account so that I can quickly access my profile without remembering another password. After clicking the "Login with Facebook" button, I expect to be prompted to authorize the app and then redirected to my account page, where I can see my recent activities and updates. This streamlined process will enhance my user experience by eliminating the need for additional login credentials and allowing me to engage with the app more efficiently.

**User Acceptance Tests:**

1. Test that users can log in successfully using their Facebook account and are taken to their account page, confirming that their recent activities and updates are displayed correctly.
2. Verify that users who deny authorization receive an appropriate message indicating that the login was unsuccessful and that they remain on the login page.
3. Check that users can log out successfully and that their session is terminated correctly, ensuring that they cannot access their account without logging in again.
4. Ensure that the app handles cases where the Facebook account is not linked to an existing app account by prompting the user to create a new account, and that the account creation process is straightforward and user-friendly.
